thread.title: Dan Sultan recognised as Age Music Victoria Genre Awards 2015 finalists revealed
thread.title_full: Dan Sultan recognised as Age Music Victoria Genre Awards 2015 finalists revealed

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Dan Sultan recognised as Age Music Victoria Genre Awards 2015 finalists revealed
text:
ARIA Award-winning Dan Sultan has been recognised in the Best Indigenous Act category. 
﻿ Vote in the 2015 Age Music Victoria Awards Courtney Barnett's swag of nominations Line-up for 10th anniversary concert The finalists for the third annual Age Music Victoria Genre Awards have been revealed, with strong competition across all genres from gospel to jazz.
ARIA Award-winning artist Dan Sultan is a notable finalist, nominated in the indigenous category.
The genre awards are in addition to the decade-long Age Music Victoria Awards, which nominate artists for gongs such as best album and best song of the year.
Advertisement Announcing the finalists on Tuesday, Music Victoria CEO Patrick Donovan said the line-up highlighted the strength of Victoria's music scene.
"Victoria is one of the few scenes in the world that can warrant its own genre awards such is the strength of diversity. Congratulations to this year's nominees," he said.
In recognition of their achievement, all finalists in the competition will receive a rehearsal package at Bakehouse Studios in Richmond.
The winners will be announced at an awards ceremony on November 11, where nominee Courtney Barnett will perform alongside artists such as Marlon Williams.
The Age Music Victoria Awards are the largest publicly voted music awards in Australia.
Best Blues Album  
Blue Heat - One Day Too Long 
Blues Mountain - Separation Street  
Fiona Boyes – Box & Dice 
Greg Dodd & The Hoodoo Men -  Movin' On  
Lloyd Spiegel - Double Live Set 
 
Best Country Album  
Jemma & The Clifton Hillbillies - Self Titled 
Ben Mastwyk - Mornin', Evenin' 
Mustered Courage - White Lies & Melodies 
Raised By Eagles - Diamonds In The Bloodstream 
Marlon Williams - Self Titled 
 
Best Soul, Funk, R'n'B and Gospel Album  
Emma Donovan & The Putbacks – Dawn 
Mojo Juju - Seeing Red / Feeling Blue  
The Paul Kelly - Merri Soul Sessions 
Seven Ups - Self-Titled 
Women of Soul - Self-Titled 
 
Best Jazz Album  
Allan Browne Quintet – Ithaca Bound 
Jack Earle Big Band – Self Titled 
Barney McAll – Mooroolbark 
Refraction – As We Were 
Paul Van Ross – Mi Alma Cuban: My Cuban Soul 
 
Best Hip Hop Album  
Ciecmate - Limbo

Tornts - No Compromise 
Spit & Mac - The Hourglass

Best Electronic Act  
Andras & Oscar
I'lls
Roland Tings
Total Giovanni
Wabz
 
Best Heavy Album  
Cuntz - Force the Zone 
Fuck the Fitzroy Doom Scene - Facing the Ruin 
High Tension – Bully 
King Parrot - Dead Set

Best Indigenous Act  
Briggs 
Emma Donovan 
Philly 
Dan Sultan 
Benny Walker 
 
Best Global or Reggae Album

Ruth Roshan & Tango Noir - Stories of Love & Regret

Suzannah Espie - Mother's Not Feeling Herself Today
